ygData.subject: Open Question Re: General Statement of Substrate/Hypercube Definition
ygData.msgSnippet: I believe that, similar to the input and output layers, there should be hidden layers which can exploit the same geometric principles as input and output

I believe that, similar to the input and output layers, there should 
be "h=
idden" layers which can exploit the same geometric principles as 
input and=
 output layers.  In this case, hidden nodes will have a 
dimensionality ass=
ociated with them.

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "afcarl2" <a.carl@...> wro=
te:
>
> It would seem that the issue of substrate hidden nodes is mitigated=
 
> somewhat by the fact that in certain instances they are nothing 
more 
=
> than duplicated substrate input and/or output nodes, created for 
the 
> =
sole purpose of handling input-to-input or output-to-input 
> connections, =
due to the current limitation that a) nodes only have 
> one unique input, =
and b) an input has no activation function. In 
this 
> case, the dimension=
ality of the clone node may reasonably carry 
with 
> it the dimensionality=
 of the original.
> 
> A true substrate hidden (i.e. not a computational du=
pe), would not 
> have a clear dimensionality associated with it. So the qu=
estion is, 
> is there a meaningful way to present a true substrate hidden =
node 
to 
> a hypercube network, or simply have the hypercube network ignor=
e 
the 
> true substrate hidden nodes, and evolve the true substrate hidden=
 
> nodes and associated connections to whatever, in the substrate 
> netwo=
rk separate from the hypercube network (i.e. hypercube network 
> only oper=
ates on "b" & "c" for PSIs and PSOs, and their clones).
> 
> Other thoughts=
 and/or comments are appreciated!
> Thanks,
>    Andy Carl
> 
> 
> 
> --- I=
n neat@yahoogroups.com, "afcarl2" <a.carl@> wrote:
> >
> > Given an arbitra=
ry point "P" in design space, comprised of the 
> > following:
> > (a) prob=
lem specific inputs (PSIs);
> > (b) auxiliary additional parameters associa=
ted w/ PSIs;
> > (c) problem specific outputs (PSOs);
> > (d) auxiliary add=
itional parameters associated w/ PSOs;
> > 
> > An instance of a struct of =
items identified in (a) through (d) 
> above, 
> > which taken together com=
prise a design point P[i], a vector of 
> which 
> > comprises the current =
substrate resolution.
> > 
> > Substrate Inputs: comprised of PSIs, "a" abo=
ve;
> > Substrate Outputs: comprised of PSOs, "c" above;
> > 
> > Hypercube=
 Inputs: comprised of auxiliary additional parameters 
> > associated w/ PS=
Is & PSOs, "b" & "d" above;
> > Hypercube Output: weight between current pa=
ir of nodes
> > 
> > Questions:
> > (1) When the dimensionality of "b" and =
"d" differ, how is the 
> > hypercube input topology reconciled?
> > (2) Ar=
e there different hypercube networks depending on if the 
> > current node =
(input or output), is a substrate input, hidden or 
> > output node?
> > (3=
) How are substrate hidden nodes handled when the hypercube is 
> > focused=
 on the associated connecting substrate weight? (variation 
> on 
> > quest=
ion 2)
